info.name: IMPS API Collection v2.1
info.description:
Complete IMPS API Collection for NPCI and Switch endpoints including:
- Pay (Fund Transfer)
- ChkTxn (Check Transaction Status)
- Heartbeat (System Monitoring)
- ListAccPvd (List Account Providers)
- ValAdd (Name Enquiry)
- Manual Trigger (JSON → ISO for testing)

API Formats:
- NPCI Endpoints: XML (application/xml)
- Switch Endpoints: Accept BOTH application/xml AND application/octet-stream (ISO). Mock Switch converts XML to ISO internally, then sends ISO to IMPS Backend.
- IMPS Backend sends ISO (application/octet-stream) to Mock Switch.
- Manual Trigger: JSON (application/json)

Ports:
- NPCI Backend: 8081
- Switch Mock: 8082

Flow:
1. NPCI (XML) → IMPS Backend (8081) → ISO 8583 → Mock Switch (8082)
2. Mock Switch (8082) → ISO 8583 → IMPS Backend (8081) → XML → NPCI
3. Postman → Mock Switch: Send XML (Content-Type: application/xml); Mock Switch converts to ISO, logs, and for response APIs forwards ISO to IMPS Backend.
4. Manual Trigger: Postman (JSON) → Mock Switch → ISO → IMPS Backend → NPCI

Database Tables:
- imps_db: transaction, message_audit_log
- switch_db: audit_log

Last Updated: 2026-01-27

item.name: NPCI Endpoints (Port 8081)
item.description: All NPCI XML API endpoints - IMPS Backend running on port 8081

item.name: ReqPay - P2A Fund Transfer (Remitter to NPCI)

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ns2:ReqPay xmlns:ns2="http://npci.org/upi/schema/" xmlns:ns3="http://npci.org/cm/schema/">
    <Head msgId="5t2Dk18UFMIMFENLBga"
          orgId="{{orgId}}"
          prodType="IMPS"
          ts="2026-01-25T10:30:00.000+05:30"
          ver="2.0"/>

    <Txn custRef="023113001276"
         id="NPCI000000005t2Dk18UFMIMFENLBgb"
         initiationMode="00"
         note="P2A Fund Transfer"
         purpose="00"
         refCategory="00"
         refId="001276"
         refUrl="https://www.npci.org.in/"
         ts="2026-01-25T10:30:00.000+05:30"
         type="PAY"/>

    <Payer addr="{{orgId}}@psp"
           code="4814"
           name="SENDER NAME"
           seqNum="1"
           type="ENTITY">

        <Info>
            <Identity id="1009492174134|HDFC0001234"
                      type="BANK"
                      verifiedName="SENDER NAME"/>
            <Rating verifiedAddress="TRUE"/>
        </Info>

        <Device>
            <Tag name="cardAccpTrId" value="NPC16511"/>
            <Tag name="cardAccIdCode" value="NPC919494916511"/>
            <Tag name="MOBILE" value="919494916511"/>
            <Tag name="TYPE" value="MOB"/>
            <Tag name="LOCATION" value="HDFC BANK MUMBAI MOB9494916511IN"/>
        </Device>

        <Ac addrType="MOBILE">
            <Detail name="MMID" value="4002111"/>
            <Detail name="MOBNUM" value="919494916511"/>
            <Detail name="ACTYPE" value="SAVINGS"/>
        </Ac>

        <Creds>
            <Cred type="PreApproved" subType="NA">
                <Data>MDB8QVBQUk9WRUQ</Data>
            </Cred>
        </Creds>

        <Amount curr="INR" value="1000.00"/>
    </Payer>

    <Payees>
        <Payee code="0000" seqNum="0" type="PERSON">
            <Ac addrType="ACCOUNT">
                <Detail name="IFSC" value="ICIC0001234"/>
                <Detail name="ACNUM" value="119551457076"/>
                <Detail name="ACTYPE" value="SAVINGS"/>
            </Ac>
            <Amount curr="INR" value="1000.00"/>
        </Payee>
    </Payees>
</ns2:ReqPay>

request.description:
ReqPay API for initiating fund transfer requests.

Flow: Remitter Bank → NPCI

Type: PAY (Debit from Payer)

Returns: ACK message

request.description:
ReqPay CREDIT type - Sent from NPCI to Beneficiary Bank for crediting the amount.

type = CREDIT indicates this is a credit request to beneficiary.

request.description:
RespPay - Credit Response from Beneficiary Bank to NPCI.

result = SUCCESS indicates successful credit.
respCode = 00 indicates success.

request.description:
RespPay Failure Response.

Common Error Codes:
- U30: Beneficiary bank not available
- U31: Invalid beneficiary IFSC
- U14: Invalid/Incorrect payee MMID
- U12: Invalid/Incorrect payee account number

request.description:

- orgTxnId: Original Transaction ID to check
- orgRrn: Original RRN (Customer Reference)

item.name: Switch Endpoints (Port 8082)
item.description:
Mock Switch (port 8082) - Accepts BOTH XML and ISO.

Content-Type: Use application/xml with XML body OR application/octet-stream with ISO binary.
Mock Switch converts XML → ISO internally, then processes (log, validate). For response endpoints, Mock Switch forwards ISO to IMPS Backend.

Request Endpoints:
- POST /switch/reqpay/2.1, /reqchktxn/2.1, /reqhbt/2.1, /reqvaladd/2.1, /reqlistaccpvd/2.1

Response Endpoints (Mock Switch forwards ISO to IMPS Backend):
- POST /switch/resppay/2.1, /respchktxn/2.1, /resphbt/2.1, /respvaladd/2.1, /resplistaccpvd/2.1

IMPS Backend sends ISO (application/octet-stream) to Switch. Postman can send XML (application/xml) for testing; Mock Switch converts to ISO.

item.name: Manual Trigger (JSON) - Port 8082
item.description:
Manual trigger endpoints for testing - NO AUTO-RESPONSE MODE.

Mock Switch does NOT auto-respond to requests. You must manually trigger responses.

These endpoints accept JSON and convert to ISO 8583 internally.

Flow: Postman (JSON) → Mock Switch → ISO 8583 → IMPS Backend → XML → NPCI

Available Triggers:
- POST /trigger/resppay - RespPay ISO 0210 (Fund Transfer Response)
- POST /trigger/respchktxn - RespChkTxn ISO 0210 (Status Check Response)
- POST /trigger/resphbt - RespHbt ISO 0810 (Heartbeat Response)
- POST /trigger/respvaladd - RespValAdd ISO 0210 (Name Enquiry Response)
- POST /trigger/resplistaccpvd - RespListAccPvd ISO 0210 (List Providers Response)
- POST /trigger/reqpay - ReqPay ISO 0200 (Switch-initiated Request)

body.raw:
{
  "rrn": "769371630886",
  "amount": "1000.00",
  "payerAccount": "1009492174134",
  "payeeAccount": "119551457076",
  "txnId": "NPCI000000005t2Dk18UFMIMFENLBgb",
  "responseCode": "00",
  "approvalNumber": "123456",
  "processingCode": "400000",
  "currency": "356"
}

request.description:
Manually trigger a RespPay ISO message from Mock Switch to IMPS Backend.

This simulates the beneficiary bank sending a credit response.

Flow: JSON → ISO 0210 → IMPS Backend → XML RespPay → NPCI

**Fields:**
- rrn: Retrieval Reference Number (DE37)
- amount: Transaction amount (e.g., "1000.00")
- payerAccount: Payer account (DE102)
- payeeAccount: Payee account (DE103)
- txnId: Original transaction ID (DE120)
- responseCode: "00" for success, other codes for failure
- approvalNumber: Bank approval number (DE38)
- processingCode: "400000" for fund transfer
- currency: "356" for INR

  "responseCode": "51",

  "processingCode": "400000",

}

Trigger a FAILURE RespPay response.

Common failure codes:
- 51: Insufficient funds
- 91: Issuer unavailable
- 12: Invalid transaction

This simulates a transaction originating from the Switch side.

Flow: JSON → ISO 0200 → IMPS Backend → XML ReqPay → NPCI

Trigger RespChkTxn ISO 0210 for transaction status check response.
Trigger RespHbt ISO 0810 for heartbeat response.

item.name: Reference - Response Codes
item.description: Common IMPS/NPCI Response Codes for reference

request.description:
**RESPONSE CODES REFERENCE (This is not an actual API)**

**Success Codes:**
- 00 - Transaction Successful

**Failure Codes:**
- U12 - Invalid/Incorrect payee account number
- U14 - Invalid/Incorrect payee MMID
- U30 - Beneficiary bank not available
- U31 - Invalid beneficiary IFSC
- U48 - Transaction not permitted to card holder
- U51 - Insufficient funds
- U66 - Device fingerprint mismatch
- U68 - Credentials not present
- U78 - Transaction Declined
- 91 - Issuer unavailable
- 12 - Invalid transaction
- 51 - Insufficient funds
- 96 - System malfunction

**Account Types (ACTYPE):**
- SAVINGS
- CURRENT
- DEFAULT
- NRE
- NRO
- CREDIT
- PPIWALLET
- BANKWALLET
- SOD
- UOD
- SEMICLOSEDPPIWALLET
- SEMICLOSEDBANKWALLET
- SNRR

**Transaction Types:**
- PAY - Debit from Payer
- CREDIT - Credit to Payee
- VR - Verification Request (ChkTxn)
- NameEnq - Name Enquiry
- ValAdd - Address Validation
- Hbt - Heartbeat
- ListAccPvd - List Account Providers

**Initiation Modes:**
- 00 - Default (Mobile)
- 12 - FIR (Foreign Inward Remittance)

**Device Types:**
- MOB - Mobile
- WAP - WAP
- IVR - IVR
- ATM - ATM
- BRC - Branch
- MAT - Mobile Assisted Transaction
- SMS - SMS

**Institution Routes (for FIR):**
- MTSS - Money Transfer Service Scheme
- RDA - Rupee Drawing Arrangement

**RefCategory Values:**
- 00 - NULL
- 01 - Advertisement
- 02 - Invoice
- 03-09 - Reserved
